rating: CSS is pretty essential and a knowledge that is assumed to be mastered for any front-end developer. Though it is not something that you can get better by just reading about, it is a skill that is developed over time.
css3.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the look and formatting of a document written in a markup language.
css3.reason: CSS provides the web designer / developer with immense expressive power over the styling of the elements. When done right it really has the potential to make a significant difference in the presentation of a project. Even though the basic knowledge of CSS is easy to acquire, becoming comfortable with it requires practice.
status: I am currently working on simple projects that require lots of CSS work. This provides the right incentives to enhance my knowledge in CSS further.
css3.name: CSS3

jquery.description: jQuery is a cross-platform JavaScript library designed to simplify the client-side scripting of HTML. jQuery is the most popular JavaScript library in use today. jQuery is free, open-source software licensed under the MIT License.
jquery.name: Jquery

threejs.description: Three.js is a lightweight cross-browser JavaScript library/API used to create and display animated 3D computer graphics on a Web browser. Three.js uses WebGL.
threejs.name: Three.js

javascript.name: Javascript

VIDEO: Frontend Masters - Hardcore Functional Programming in JavaScript

javascript.description: JavaScript, also known as ECMAScript (the untrademarked name used for the standard), is a dynamic programming language. It is most commonly used as part of web browsers, whose implementations allow client-side scripts to interact with the user, control the browser, communicate asynchronously, and alter the document content that is displayed

python.description: Python is a widely used general-purpose, high-level programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability, and its syntax allows programmers to express concepts in fewer lines of code than would be possible in languages such as C++ or Java. The language provides constructs intended to enable clear programs on both a small and large scale.

this book seems to be awesome, where you: Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures Using Python SECOND EDITION

roughly in this order:: computer science fundamentals for self-taught programmers
so you want to be a full stack developer

python.name: Python

bootstrap.name: Bootstrap
bootstrap.description: Bootstrap is a free and open-source collection of tools for creating websites and web applications. It contains HTML- and CSS-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation and other interface components, as well as optional JavaScript extensions. The bootstrap framework aims to ease web development.

scrum.description: Scrum is an iterative and incremental agile software development methodology for managing product development. It defines "a flexible, holistic product development strategy where a development team works as a unit to reach a common goal", challenges assumptions of the "traditional, sequential approach" to product development, and enables teams to self-organize by encouraging physical co-location or close online collaboration of all team members, as well as daily face-to-face communication among all team members and disciplines in the project.
scrum.name: Scrum

django.description: Django is a free and open source web application framework, written in Python, which follows the model–view–controller (MVC) architectural pattern. It is maintained by the Django Software Foundation (DSF), an independent organization established as a 501(c)(3) non-profit.
django.reason: Django is the framework that I have entered the world of web development with. To me it is a platform that gives me the opportunity to quickly deploy ideas online. Also being the baseline of my backend knowledge, it frames all the other new ideas for me as they get introduced. I eventually want to acquire more knowledge of backend tools and frameworks such as Node as they seem to currently have more prevalence. But meanwhile Django still serves as a strong platform to keep growing in.
status: I would like to refresh my old knowledge of Django and update it for the current version. I also would like to structure my further knowledge acquisition. Not planning to go too deep with it though. Just have enough of it so that it can serve as a strong foundation for front end projects. But I need to find out how to create restful websites using Django to familiarize myself with the concept.
plan: Skim 'Tango with Dango' to update your knowledge of it.
Look into web resources for Django and Angular integration
Go through the documentation of Django Rest Framework
Look into 'Restful' Chapters from the book 'Lightweight Django'
django.name: Django

react.description: React, sometimes styled React.js or ReactJS, is an open-source JavaScript library for creating user interfaces that aims to address challenges encountered in developing single-page applications. It is maintained by Facebook, Instagram and a community of individual developers and corporations.
react.name: React.js

bower.description: Bower is a package management system for client-side programming on the World Wide Web. It depends on Node.js and npm. It works with git and GitHub repositories.
bower.name: Bower

html5.name: HTML5
html5.description: HyperText Markup Language, commonly referred to as HTML, is the standard markup language used to create web pages.

rating: Angular seems awesome. But it is too polarizing and undependable to have a higher rating. Also it's popularity in decline due to new contenders in the MVC playfield and drastic changes that Angular 2.0 is bringing to the table. Definitely not a core competency but very good to have due to wealth of projects out there that is utilizing it.
angularjs.description: AngularJS is a structural framework for dynamic web apps. It lets you use HTML as your template language and lets you extend HTML's syntax to express your application's components clearly and succinctly. Angular's data binding and dependency injection eliminate much of the code you would otherwise have to write. And it all happens within the browser, making it an ideal partner with any server technology.
angularjs.summary: To Be Summarized. We thrive because of our immersive proposition and best-of-breed team player culture. We aim to conservatively connect our cloud by globally monetizing our actionable mobile dot-bombs. Going forward, our wholesale silo will deliver value to visibilities. Going forward, our best-in-class synergy will deliver value to market foci.
angularjs.reason: There is a strong market incentive for learning Angular. Being the trendy front-end framework of late times, there are lots of projects out there utilizing it. Also it really makes it easy to create data bound elements removing the need for some laborious and repetitive front end coding.
status: Try to utilize it in your projects but also try to avoid going too deep into it. The primary reason being the imminent launch of Angular 2.0, which is changing the framework in very fundamental ways.
angularjs.plan: Look into integration of Django and Angular

Online: udemy - angularjs jumpstart with dan wahlin
udemy - build a real time web app in node.js, angular.js and mongo.db

angularjs.name: Angular.js

rating: Apart from being the go-to library for creating data driven visualizations D3 has also have a huge community for support, lots of examples and tutorials to learn from. Besides the initial learning curve is not that steep and most usage cases are not too technically demanding. The only downside with D3 is that the skill set doesn't seem to possess too much market value.
d3.name: D3.js
d3.reason: D3 is a low level library that allows for creating visualizations that you have lots of control over. This feature makes D3 to be an excellent playground of both programming and data visualizations. Integrating with other libraries and API's, you can easily create useful Web Apps that visualize data to inform and educate people. Certainly a useful and fun tool to learn more about.
status: Utilize D3 in side projects that you are working on to some degree. Allows for creating a context where you can create visualizations while using other tools that you want to learn more about such as : D3 + Angular, D3 + React, D3 + Three.JS. You can put acquiring further D3 language into backburner and let it happen organically as you are working with it in the context of other projects.
d3.description: D3.js (or just D3 for Data-Driven Documents) is a JavaScript library for producing dynamic, interactive data visualizations in web browsers. It makes use of the widely implemented SVG, HTML5, and CSS standards.
